structured.description: A Camera class that represents a 3D camera in a mathematical framework. The camera can be moved and rotated using its transform property, and it has a projection matrix that determines how the camera sees its surroundings. The code also provides methods to calculate the view and projection matrices, which are used to render 3D scenes. Additionally, there is an abstract class called CameraStruct that provides a way to store camera data in a standardized format.

items.description: Is an abstract class that provides methods for calculating and manipulating matrices related to camera functionality. It has fields for projection, viewProjectionMat4, values, transform, and allows for calculation of projection matrix and adjustment to the viewport size. Additionally, it provides abstract methods for calculateProjectionMatrix and adjustToViewport, and a protected class for CameraStruct.
items.name: Camera

items.description: Retrieves a `Matrix4f` object representing the view projection transformation, calculating it if necessary based on the current view and transformation matrices.

returns.description: a `Matrix4f` object representing the view projection matrix.

usage.code:
Camera camera = new PerspectiveCamera(new Matrix4f().initPerspective(fov, aspectRatio, nearPlane, farPlane));
Matrix4f viewProjectionMatrix = camera.getViewProjection();

items.name: getViewProjection

items.description: Calculates a view matrix for a 3D scene based on the rotation and translation of a camera. The view matrix is used to transform 3D points from world space to screen space.

returns.description: a matrix representing the view transformation of a 3D scene from a camera's perspective.

usage.description: In this example, we create a new instance of the Camera class using an empty Matrix4f for the projection matrix. We then set the position and rotation of the transform associated with the camera to values that are appropriate for our use case (a camera looking at the origin from a distance of 5 units). Finally, we call the calculateViewProjection method on the camera instance, which will return a Matrix4f representing the view-projection matrix. This matrix can then be used to render the scene from the perspective of the camera.

items.name: calculateViewMatrix

items.description: Calculates a translation matrix that moves the camera position by a distance equal to its negation.

returns.description: a 4x4 transformation matrix representing the camera's position in the world, translated by a specified amount in the x, y, and z directions.

items.name: getTranslationMatrix

items.description: Retrieves and returns the `transform` object, which is an instance of the `Transform` class.

returns.description: a reference to an instance of the `Transform` class.

usage.code:
Camera myCamera = new Camera();
Transform transform = myCamera.getTransform();

items.name: getTransform

items.description: Is an abstract class that serves as a base for other classes in the package com.ch.math. It provides an abstract method called getAsMatrix4() that returns a Matrix4f object, which can be used to perform various calculations related to camera and matrix operations.
items.name: CameraStruct

structured.description: A `Texture` class that loads an image as a texture and binds it to a specific OpenGL texture slot. It also provides a method to get the ID of the loaded texture. The code uses the Java GL11 package to handle the OpenGL binding and texturing operations.

items.description: Is used to handle texture mapping in graphics programming. It loads and manages textures, allowing for easy binding and manipulation. The class provides methods for loading and binding textures, as well as getting the ID of a loaded texture.
items.name: Texture

items.description: 0 invokes the `bind` method on the `java.lang.Object` class, passing `0` as the argument.
items.name: bind

items.description: Sets the active texture slot to a specific value (0-31) and binds a texture ID to that slot using glBindTexture().

params.name: samplerSlot
params.description: 0-based index of the texture slot to bind a texture to within the current active texture group, with values ranging from 0 to 31.

items.name: bind

usage.code:
Texture tex = new Texture("textureFile");
int id = tex.getID();

items.description: Loads a texture image from a file and stores it as a GL_RGBA8 texture in memory. It generates mipmaps and sets the appropriate texture parameters for linear filtering and lod bias.

params.name: fileName
params.description: file path of the image to load as a texture.

returns.description: an integer identifier of a texture object created from an image file.

items.name: loadTexture

structured.description: A 3D camera class called `Camera3D` that extends the base `Camera` class. The code sets up a camera struct with various parameters such as field of view (FOV), aspect ratio, near and far distances, and then creates a new matrix for projection. It also defines a processInput method that handles user input, including mouse movement and WASD keys for movement. Finally, it sets the position of the camera using the `setPos` method.

items.description: Is a custom camera class that extends the Camera class and provides additional functionality for manipulating the camera's position and orientation in 3D space. The class has several methods for calculating matrix transformations, adjusting to the viewport, and processing input from the user. Additionally, it has a protected inner class called CameraStruct3D that stores camera parameters and provides methods for calculating perspective projections and rotations.
items.name: Camera3D

items.description: Calculates a matrix representing the projection of a 3D scene from a camera's perspective. The returned matrix contains the projection parameters in a `Matrix4f` format.

params.name: data
params.description: 3D camera's properties, such as its position, view angle, and field of view, which are used to calculate the projection matrix.

returns.description: a Matrix4f object representing the camera's projection matrix.

items.name: calculateProjectionMatrix

items.description: Adjusts a 3D camera's projection and view matrices to fit within the viewport of a given size.

params.name: width
params.description: width of the viewport for which the function is adjusting the camera's projection and view matrices.

params.name: height
params.description: 2D viewport dimension of the camera's field of view, which is used to calculate the view matrix and set the viewport dimensions in GL11.glViewport().

items.name: adjustToViewport

items.description: Is an extension of the CameraStruct class that includes additional parameters to represent a 3D camera's field of view, aspect ratio, near and far distances. The class provides a method to return the camera's projection matrix as a Matrix4f object, which can be used for rendering purposes.
items.name: CameraStruct3D

items.description: Generates a matrix representation of the current perspective projection, initialized with field of view (fov), aspect ratio, near and far distances.

returns.description: a matrix representation of a perspective projection, with field of view (fov), aspect ratio, near and far distances for the z-buffer.

usage.description: In this example, the values of fov, aspect, zNear, and zFar are initialized to 60, 1280 / 720, 0.1f, and 1000.0f respectively. Then, a new CameraStruct3D instance is created with these values, followed by the use of the method getAsMatrix4() to retrieve a perspective projection matrix that represents the camera's parameters.

items.name: getAsMatrix4

items.description: Processes input from the mouse and keyboard, rotating the object based on input and moving it along a direction based on keyboard inputs.

params.name: dt
params.description: 3D time interval (in seconds) since the last frame, and is used to calculate the movement of the object based on its speed.

params.name: speed
params.description: 3D movement speed of the object being controlled by the function, which is multiplied by the time elapsed (represented by `dt`) to determine the total distance moved.

params.name: sens
params.description: sensitivity of the character's movement, and it is used to calculate the amount of rotation applied to the character's position based on the user's mouse input.

usage.description:
In this example, the value of dt is set to 0.1f, which represents the time elapsed since the last frame. The value of speed is set to 10.0f, which represents the movement speed in units per second. The value of sensitivity is set to 0.2f, which represents the mouse sensitivity.
The processInput method takes these three values as input and uses them to update the camera's position and rotation based on user input.

items.name: processInput

items.description: Takes a direction vector `dir` and a magnitude `amt` as input, and moves the position of an object represented by a `Transform` instance by adding the dot product of `dir` and `amt` to its current position.

params.name: dir
params.description: 3D direction to move the object in the specified amount.

params.name: amt
params.description: amount of movement along the specified direction, which is added to the current position of the transform.

items.name: move
